html: When the Assyrian alliance is at last overthrown, the world it conquered becomes Jehovah’s. Although the archtyrant boasted that he had “done away with the borders of nations” (Isaiah 10:13; cf. 14:6, 12, 16-17, 21; 37:18), after Jehovah’s servant vanquishes him, the whole earth is restored to its Maker (Isaiah 12:4-6; 27:2-3; 52:7-10; 54:5; 60:21; 62:11; 66:1). Jehovah “enlarges” (yasapta) the nation of his people by restoring the descendants of Joseph (yosep) and Judah, reuniting them through the instrumentality of his servant (Isaiah 9:3-7; 11:10-14; 49:5-6; 55:4-5; 56:8; cf. Ezekiel 37:15-22).
